_header: A man without mercy mercy shall miss
Note:
Cf. 712, 1369, and 1845; Tilley (1950)
XTilley, Morris Palmer. A Dictionary of the Proverbs in England in the 16th and 17th Centuries. Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan, 1950, M 895; Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 28.

BodAsh45I.Transcription: a man with out mercy mercy shall mysse

OxfBal354.Transcription:
ffor man with owt mercy of mercy shall misseAnd he shall haue mercy
                    that merrcyfull is
OxfBal354.Note: Immediately preceded by 6341 and 3375 as if part of same text.
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
OxfBal354.Editions:
Flügel,  Ewald. 
             “Liedersammlungen des XVI Jahrhunderts….” 
             Anglia
         26 (1903): 94-285: 226.
Dyboski,  R.,
                        ed.  
             Songs, Carols and Other Miscellaneous Poems from Balliol MS. 354,
                Richard Hill’s Commonplace Book.
EETS
          e.s. 101 (1908); repr. 1984: 141.

CamStJohn195.Transcription:
A man without mercy of mercy sall misHe shall haue mercy þat
                    mercyfull is
CamStJohn195.Note:
Added to flyleaf by a hand of s. xvi; same as ‘ffor the love
                    of…’.

CULDd819.Note: Late sixteenth century (similar hand to indenture, fol.134r), a couplet on Mercy, signed “by me Mr Roberts/ Thomas Robertes.”

BLAdd60577.Transcription:
Man without mercye mercy schal mysseBut he schal haue
                    mercy þat mercyfull ys
BLAdd60577.Note: Scribe adds haue in the margin.

BLLan699.Transcription:
Aman wythe out marciOf merci shalle mysseHe shall haue
                    marciThat marci ffulle is

BLSl747.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.373.

BLYT47.Transcription:
A man without mercie of mercie shall misseBut hee shall haue mercie
                    that mercifull is
BLYT47.Note: Added to flyleaf by a hand of the sixteenth century.

GULHun230.Transcription:
A Man wythe owtt mercy mercy schall mysHe schall haue mercy that
                    mercyffull is
GULHun230.Note: Added to end flyleaf by sixteenth-century hand; also in 2728.
